dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion rocks the ship as two robots, Artoo-Detoo (R D2) and See-Threepio (C-3PO) struggle to make their way  through the shaking, bouncing passageway. Both robots are old and battered. Artoo is a short, claw-armed tripod. Hi face is a mass of computer lights surrounding a radar eye Threepio, on the other hand, is a tall, slender robot of  human proportions. He has a gleaming bronze-like metallic surface of an Art Deco design. Another blast shakes them as they struggle along their wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? They've shut down  the main reactor. We'll be destroyed  for sure. This is madness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebel troopers rush past the robots and take up positions the main passageway. They aim their weapons toward the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doomed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little R2 unit makes a series of electronic sounds th only another robot could understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be no escape for the Princess  this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo continues making beeping sounds. Tension mounts as  loud metallic latches clank and the scream of heavy equip are heard moving around the outside hull of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Imperial craft has easily overtaken the Rebel Blockad Runner. The smaller Rebel ship is being drawn into the  underside dock of the giant Imperial starship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nervous Rebel troopers aim their weapons. Suddenly a  tremendous blast opens up a hole in the main passageway a a score of fearsome armored spacesuited stormtroopers mak their way into the smoke-filled corridor. In a few minutes the entire passageway is ablaze with  laserfire. The deadly bolts ricochet in wild random patte creating huge explosions. Stormtroopers scatter and duck  behind storage lockers. Laserbolts hit several Rebel sold who scream and stagger through the smoke, holding shatter arms and faces. An explosion hits near the robots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have known better than to  trust the logic of a half-sized  thermocapsulary dehousing assister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo counters with an angry rebuttal as the battle rages around the two hapless robots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A death-white wasteland stretches from horizon to horizon The tremendous heat of two huge twin suns settle on a lon figure, Luke Skywalker, a farm boy with heroic aspiration who looks much younger than his eighteen years. His shagg hair and baggy tunic give him the air of a simple but lov lad with a prize-winning smile. A light wind whips at him as he adjusts several valves on large battered moisture vaporator which sticks out of the desert floor much like an oil pipe with valves. He is aid by a beatup tread-robot with six claw arms. The little ro appears to be barely functioning and moves with jerky mot A bright sparkle in the morning sky catches Luke's eye an he instinctively grabs a pair of electrobinoculars from h utility belt. He stands transfixed for a few moments stud the heavens, then dashed toward his dented, crudely repai Landspeeder (an auto-like transport that travels a few fe above the ground on a magnetic-field). He motions for the tiny robot to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up! Come with me! What are you  waiting for?! Get in gear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot scoots around in a tight circle, stops short, a smoke begins to pour out of every joint. Luke throws his  arms up in disgust. Exasperated, the young farm boy jumps into his Landspeeder leaving the smoldering robot to hum  madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The awesome, seven-foot-tall Dark Lord of the Sith makes way into the blinding light of the main passageway. This Darth Vader, right hand of the Emperor. His face is obscu by his flowing black robes and grotesque breath mask, whi stands out next to the fascist white armored suits of the Imperial stormtroopers. Everyone instinctively backs away from the imposing warrior and a deathly quiet sweeps thro the Rebel troops. Several of the Rebel troops break and r in a frenzied panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman's hand puts a card into an opening in Artoo's dom Artoo makes beeping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio stands in a hallway, somewhat bewildered. Artoo nowhere in sight. The pitiful screams of the doomed Rebel soldiers can be heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo! Artoo-Detoo, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar clanking sound attacks Threepio's attention an he spots little Artoo at the end of the hallway in a smok filled alcove. A beautiful young girl (about sixteen year old) stands in front of Artoo. Surreal and out of place,  dreamlike and half hidden in the smoke, she finishes adju something on Artoo's computer face, then watches as the l robot joins his companion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last! Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stormtroopers can be heard battling in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're heading in this direction.  What are we going to do? We'll be  sent to the spice mine of Kessel or  smashed into who knows what!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo scoots past his bronze friend and races down the  subhallway. Threepio chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo responds with electronic beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The evil Darth Vader stands amid the broken and twisted b of his foes. He grabs a wounded Rebel Officer by the neck an Imperial Officer rushes up to the Dark Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Death Star plans are not in the  main computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vader squeezes the neck of the Rebel Officer, who struggl in vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are those transmissions you  intercepted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vader lifts the Rebel off his feet by his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done with those plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We intercepted no transmissions.  Aaah... This is a consular ship.  Were on a diplomatic mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is a consular ship... were  is the Ambassador?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rebel refuses to speak but eventually cries out as th Dark Lord begins to squeeze the officer's throat, creatin gruesome snapping and choking, until the soldier goes lim Vader tosses the dead soldier against the wall and turns his troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, tear this ship apart until  you've found those plans and bring  me the Ambassador. I want her alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stormtroopers scurry into the subhallways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lovely young girl huddles in a small alcove as the  stormtroopers search through the ship. She is Princess Le Organa, a member of the Alderaan Senate. The fear in her  eyes slowly gives way to anger as the muted crushing soun of the approaching stormtroopers grow louder. One of the  troopers spots her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is! Set for stun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leia steps from her hiding place and blasts a trooper wit her laser pistol. She starts to run but is felled by a  paralyzing ray. The troopers inspect her inert body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be all right. Inform Lord  Vader we have a prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo stops before the small hatch of an emergency lifepo He snaps the seal on the main latch and a red warning lig begins to flash. The stubby astro-robot works his way int the cramped four-man pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're not permitted in there.  It's restricted. You'll be deactivated  for sure..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps something to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me a mindless philosopher,  you overweight glob of grease! Now  come out before somebody sees you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo whistles something at his reluctant friend regardin the mission he is about to perform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret mission? What plans? What are  you talking about? I'm not getting  in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo isn't happy with Threepio's stubbornness, and he be and twangs angrily. A new explosion, this time very close, sends dust and deb through the narrow subhallway. Flames lick at Threepio an after a flurry of electronic swearing from Artoo, the lan robot jumps into the lifepod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to regret this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the main viewscreen, the lifepod carrying the two terr robots speeds away from the stricken Rebel spacecraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your fire. There are no life  forms. It must have been short- circuited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo and Threepio look out at the receding Imperial star Stars circle as the pod rotates through the galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny, the damage doesn't  look as bad from out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps an assuring response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this things safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat waves radiate from the dozen or so bleached white  buildings. Luke pilots his Landspeeder through the dusty  empty street of the tiny settlement. An old woman runs to get out of the way of the speeding vehicle, shaking her f at Luke as he flies past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told you kids to slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke bursts into the power station, waking The Fixer, a r mechanic and Camie, a sexy, disheveled girl who has been  asleep in his lap. They grumbled as he races through the  office, yelling wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I hear a young noise blast through  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just wormie on another rampage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke bounces into a small room behind the office where De and Windy, two tough boys about the same age as Luke, are playing a computer pool-like game with Biggs, a burly,  handsome boy a few years older than the rest. His flashy  city attire is a sharp contrast to the loose-fitting tuni of the farm boys. A robot repairs some equipment in the  background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shape it up you guys!... Biggs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's surprise at the appearance of Biggs gives way to g joy and emotion. They give each other a great bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were back! When  did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now. I wanted to surprise you,  hot shot. I thought you'd be here...  certainly didn't expect you to be  out working. (he laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Academy didn't change you  much...but you're back so soon? Hey,  what happened, didn't you get your  commission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs has an air of cool that seems slightly phony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I got it. Signed aboard  The Rand Ecliptic last week. First  mate Biggs Darklighter at your  service... (he salutes) ...I just came to say good-bye to  all you unfortunate landlocked  simpletons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs. The dazzling spectacle of his dashing fr is almost too much for Luke, but suddenly he snaps out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost forgot. There's a battle  going on! Right here in our system.  Come and look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not again! Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The group stumbles out into the stifling desert sun. Cami and The Fixer complain and are forced to shade their eyes Luke has his binoculars out scanning the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs takes the binoculars from Luke as the others strain see something with the naked eye. Through the binoculars  Biggs sees two small silver specks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no battle, hot shot... they're  just sitting there! Probably a  freighter-tanker refueling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there was a lot of firing  earlier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camie grabs the binoculars away banging them against the  building in the process. Luke grabs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, easy with those...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, Wormie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fixer gives Luke a hard look and the young farm boy s his shoulders in resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep telling you, the Rebellion is  a long way from here. I doubt if the  Empire would even fight to keep this  system. Believe me Luke, this planet  is a big hunk of nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke agrees, although it's obvious he isn't sure why. The group stumbles back into the power station, grumbling abo Luke's ineptitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Princess Leia is led down a low-ceilinged hallway by a sq of armored stormtroopers. Her hands are bound and she is  brutally shoved when she is unable to keep up with the br marching troops. They stop in a smoky hallway as Darth Va emerges from the shadows. The sinister Dark Lord stares h at the frail young senator, but she doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Vader, I should have known.  Only you could be so bold. The  Imperial Senate will not sit for  this, when they hear you've attacked  a diplomatic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play games with me, Your  Highness. You weren't on any mercy  mission this time. You passed directly  through a restricted system. Several  transmissions were beamed to this  ship by Rebel spies. I want to know  what happened to the plans they sent  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about. I'm a member of the Imperial  Senate on a diplomatic mission to  Alderaan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a part of the Rebel Alliance...  and a traitor. Take her away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leia is marched away down the hallway and into the smolde hole blasted in the side of the ship. An Imperial Command turns to Vader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding her is dangerous. If word of  this gets out, it could generate  sympathy for the Rebellion in the  senate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have traced the Rebel spies to  her. Now she is my only link to find  their secret base!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll die before she tells you  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave that to me. Send a distress  signal and then inform the senate  that all aboard were killed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Imperial Officer approaches Vader and the Command They stop and snap to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Vader, the battle station plans  are not aboard this ship! And no  transmissions were made. An escape  pod was jettisoned during the  fighting, but no life forms were  aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vader turns to the Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must have hidden the plans in  the escape pod. Send a detachment  down to retrieve them. See to it  personally, Commander. There'll be  no one to stop us this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Imperial Stardestroyer comes over the surface of the  planet Tatooine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jundland, or "No Man's Land", where the rugged desert mes meet the foreboding dune sea. The two helpless astro-droi kick up clouds of sand as they leave the lifepod and clum work their way across the desert wasteland. The lifepod i the distance rests half buried in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did I get into this mess? I really  don't know how. We seem to be made  to suffer. It's our lot in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo answers with beeping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to rest before I fall apart.  My joints are almost frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo continues to respond with beeping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a desolate place this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Artoo whistles, makes a sharp right turn and sta off in the direction of the rocky desert mesas. Threepio  stops and yells at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stream of electronic noises pours forth from the small  robot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not going that way. It's  much too rocky. This way is much  easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo counters with a long whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think there are  settlements over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get technical with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What mission? What are you talking  about? I've had just about enough of  you! Go that way! You'll be  malfunctioning within a day, you  nearsighted scrap pile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio gives the little robot a kick and starts off in direction of the vast dune sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't let me catch you following  me begging for help, because you  won't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo's reply is a rather rude sound. He turns and trudge off in the direction of the towering mesas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more adventures. I'm not going  that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps to himself as he makes his way toward the dis mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio, hot and tired, struggles up over the ridge of a dune; only to find more dunes, which seem to go on for en miles.  He looks back in the direction of the now distant rock mesas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That malfunctioning little twerp.  This is all his fault! He tricked me  into going this way, but he'll do no  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a huff of anger and frustration, Threepio knocks the s from his joints. His plight seems hopeless, when a glint reflected light in the distance reveals an object moving  towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what's that? A transport! I'm  saved!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bronze android waves frantically and yells at the  approaching transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! Help! Please, help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Biggs are walking and drinking a malt brew. Fixe and the others can be heard working inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Very animated) ...so I cut off my power, shut down  the afterburners and came in low on  Deak's trail. I was so close I thought  I was going to fry my instruments.  As it was I busted up the Skyhopper  pretty bad. Uncle Owen was pretty  upset. He grounded me for the rest  of the season. You should have been  there... it was fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to take it easy Luke. You  may be the hottest bushpilot this  side of Mos Eisley, but those little  Skyhoppers are dangerous. Keep it  up, and one day, whammo, you're going  to be nothing more than a dark spot  on the down side of a canyon wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's talking. Now that you've  been around those giant starships  you're beginning to sound like my  uncle. You've gotten soft in the  city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, things haven't been the same  since you left, Biggs. It's been  so... quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs looks around then leans close to Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, I didn't come back just to say  good-bye... I shouldn't tell you  this, but you're the only one I can  trust... and if I don't come back, I  want somebody to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's eyes are wide with Biggs' seriousness and loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made some friends at the Academy. (he whispers) ...when our frigate goes to one of  the central systems, we're going to  jump ship and join the Alliance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, amazed and stunned, is almost speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join the Rebellion?! Are you kidding!  How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet down will ya! You got a mouth  bigger than a meteor crater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm quiet. (he whispers) Listen how quiet I am. You can barely  hear me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs shakes his head angrily and then continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend has a friend on Bestine  who might help us make contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy! You could wander around  forever trying to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's a long shot, but if I  don't find them I'll do what I can  on my own... It's what we always  talked about. Luke, I'm not going to  wait for the Empire to draft me into  service. The Rebellion is spreading  and I want to be on the right side --  the side I believe in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm stuck here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to the  Academy next term. You'll get your  chance to get off this rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not likely! I had to cancel my  application. There has been a lot of  unrest among the Sandpeople since  you left... they've even raided the  outskirts of Anchorhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle could hold off a whole  colony of Sandpeople with one blaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but he's got enough vaporators  going to make the place pay off. He  needs me for just one more season. I  can't leave him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel for you, Luke, you're going  to have to learn what seems to be  important or what really is important.  What good is all your uncle's work  if it's taken over by the Empire?...  You know they're starting to  nationalize commerce in the central  systems... it won't be long before  your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving  for the greater glory of the Empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't happen here. You said it  yourself. The Empire won't bother  with this rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things always change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was going... Are you going  to be around long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm leaving in the morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess I won't see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe someday... I'll keep a lookout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be at the Academy next  season... after that who knows. I  won't be drafted into the Imperial  Starfleet that's for sure... Take  care of yourself, you'll always be  the best friend I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs turns away from his old friend and heads towards th power station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gargantuan rock formations are shrouded in a strange  foreboding mist and the onimous sounds of unearthly creat fill the air. Artoo moves cautiously through the creepy r canyon, inadvertently making a loud clicking noise as he  goes. He hears a distant, hard, metallic sound and stops a moment. Convinced he is alone, he continues on his way. In the distance, a pebble tumbles down the steep canyon w and a small dark figure darts into the shadows. A little  further up the canyon a slight flicker of light reveals a pair of eyes in the dark recesses only a few feet from th narrow path. The unsuspecting robot waddles along the rugged trail unt suddenly, out of nowhere, a powerful magnetic ray shoots of the rocks and engulfs him in an eerie glow. He manages one short electronic squeak before he topples over onto h back. His bright computer lights flicker off, then on, th off again. Out of the rocks scurry three Jawas, no taller than Artoo. They holster strange and complex weapons as t cautiously approach the robot. They wear grubby cloaks an their faces are shrouded so only their glowing eyes can b seen. They hiss and make odd guttural sounds as they heav the heavy robot onto their shoulders and carry him off do the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eight Jawas carry Artoo out of the canyon to a huge t like vehicle the size of a four-story house. They weld a  small disk on the side of Artoo and then put him under a  large tube on the side of the vehicle and the little robo is sucked into the giant machine. The filthy little Jawas scurry like rats up small ladders and enter the main cabin of the behemoth transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dim inside the hold area of the Sandcrawler. Artoo  switches on a small floodlight on his forehead and stumbl around the scrap heap. The narrow beam swings across rust metal rocket parts and an array of grotesquely twisted an maimed astro-robots. He lets out a pathetic electronic wh and stumbles off toward what appears to be a door at the of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo enters a wide room with a four-foot ceiling. In the middle of the scrap heap sit a dozen or so robots of vari shapes and sizes. Some are engaged in electronic conversa while others simply mill about. A voice of recognition ca out from the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo-Detoo! It's you! It's you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered Threepio scrambles up to Artoo and embraces hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enormous Sandcrawler lumbers off toward the magnifice twin suns, which are slowly setting over a distant mounta ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four Imperial stormtroopers mill about in front of the ha buried lifepod that brought Artoo and Threepio to Tatooin A trooper yells to an officer some distance away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone was in the pod. The tracks  go off in this direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second trooper picks a small bit of metal out of the sa and gives it to the first trooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, sir -- droids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sandcrawler moves slowly down a great sand dune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio and Artoo noisily bounce along inside the crampe prison chamber. Artoo appears to be shut off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the shaking and bouncing of the Sandcrawler stop creating quite a commotion among the mechanical men.   Threepio's fist bangs the head of Artoo whose computer li pop on as he begins beeping. At the far end of the long  chamber a hatch opens, filling the chamber with blinding  white light. a dozen or so Jawas make their way through t odd assortment of robots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jawa starts moving toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they'll melt us down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo responds, making beeping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot! Don't shoot! Will this  never end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jawas mutter gibberish as they busily line up their  battered captives, including Artoo and Threepio, in front the enormous Sandcrawler, which is parked beside a small  homestead consisting of three large holes in the ground  surrounded by several tall moisture vaporators and one sm adobe block house. The Jawas scurry around fussing over the robots, straight them up or brushing some dust from a dented metallic elbo The shrouded little creatures smell horribly, attracting  small insects to the dark areas when their mouths and nos should be. Out of the shadows of a dingy side-building limps Owen La a large burly man in his mid-fifties. His reddish eyes ar sunken in a dust-covered face. As the farmer carefully  inspects each robot, he is closely followed by his slump- shouldered nephew, Luke Skywalker. One of the vile little Jawas walks ahead of the farmer spouting an animated sale pitch in a queer, unintelligible language. A voice calls out from one of the huge holes that form th homestead. Luke goes over to the edge and sees his Aunt B standing in the main courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, tell Owen that if he gets a  translator to be sure it speaks Bocce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like we don't have much of  a choice but I'll remind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke returns to his uncle as they look over the equipment for sale with the Jawa leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no need for a protocol droid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Sir -- not in an environment such as  this -- that's why I've also been  programmed for over thirty secondary  functions that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I really need is a droid that  understands the binary language of  moisture vaporators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaporators! Sir -- My first job was  programming binary load lifter...  very similar to your vaporators. You  could say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you speak Bocce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I can, sir. It's like a  second language for me... I'm as  fluent in Bocce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right shut up! (turning to Jawa) I'll take this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutting up, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, take these two over to the  garage, will you? I want you to have  both of them cleaned up before dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was going into Toshi Station  to pick up some power converters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can waste time with your friends  when your chores are done. Now come  on, get to it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, come on! And the red one,  come on. Well, come on, Red, let's  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Jawas start to lead the three remaining robots bac into the Sandcrawler, Artoo lets out a pathetic little be and starts after his old friend Threepio. He is restraine by a slimy Jawa, who zaps him with a control box. Owen is negotiating with the head Jawa. Luke and the two  robots start off for the garage when a plate pops off the head of the red astro-droid's head plate and it sparks wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Owen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This R2 unit has a bad motivator.  Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the head Jawa) Hey, what're you trying to push on  us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jawa goes into a loud spiel. Meanwhile, Artoo has sne out of line and is moving up and down trying to attract  attention. He lets out with a low whistle. Threepio taps  Luke on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Artoo) Excuse me, sir, but that R2 unit is  in prime condition. A real bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Owen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jawa) What about that blue one? We'll take  that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a little reluctance the scruffy dwarf trades the dam astro-droid for Artoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, take it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I'm quite sure you'll be very  pleased with that one, sir. He really  is in first-class condition. I've  worked with him before. Here he comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen pays off the whining Jawa as Luke and the two robots trudge off toward a grimy homestead entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Artoo) Now, don't you forget this! Why I  should stick my neck out for you is  quite beyond my capacity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage is cluttered and worn, but a friendly peaceful atmosphere permeates the low grey chamber. Threepio lower himself into a large tub filled with warm oil. Near the  battered Landspeeder little Artoo rests on a large batter with a cord to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank the maker! This oil bath is  going to feel so good. I've got such  a bad case of dust contamination, I  can barely move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps a muffled reply. Luke seems to be lost in tho as he runs his hand over the damaged fin of a small two-m Skyhopper spaceship resting in a low hangar off the garag Finally Luke's frustrations get the better of him and he  slams a wrench across the workbench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just isn't fair. Oh, Biggs is  right. I'm never gonna get out of  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I might do to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke glances at the battered robot. A bit of his anger dr and a tiny smile creeps across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not unless you can alter time,  speed up the harvest, or teleport me  off this rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, sir. I'm only a  droid and not very knowledgeable  about such things. Not on this planet,  anyways. As a matter of fact, I'm  not even sure which planet I'm on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if there's a bright center to  the universe, you're on the planet  that it's farthest from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, you can call me Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see, sir Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Just Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am See-Threepio, human-cyborg  relations, and this is my counterpart,  Artoo-Detoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps in response. Luke unplugs Artoo and begins to scrape several connectors on the robot's head with a chro pick. Threepio climbs out of the oil tub and begins wipin oil from his bronze body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a lot of carbon scoring here.  It looks like you boys have seen a  lot of action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all we've been through, sometimes  I'm amazed we're in as good condition  as we are, what with the Rebellion  and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know of the Rebellion against  the Empire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how we came to be in your  service, if you take my meaning,  sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been in many battles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several, I think. Actually, there's  not much to tell. I'm not much more  than an interpreter, and not very  good at telling stories. Well, not  at making them interesting, anyways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke struggles to remove a small metal fragment from Arto neck joint. He uses a larger pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my little friend, you've got  something jammed in here real good.  Were you on a cruiser or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fragment breaks loose with a snap, sending Luke tumbl head over heels. He sits up and sees a twelve-inch three- dimensional hologram of Leia Organa, the Rebel senator, b projected from the face of little Artoo. The image is a  rainbow of colors as it flickers and jiggles in the dimly lit garage. Luke's mouth hangs open in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my  only hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo looks around and sheepishly beeps an answer for Thr to translate. Leia continues to repeat the sentence fragm over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is what?!? He asked you a  question... (pointing to Leia) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo whistles his surprise as he pretends to just notice the hologram. He looks around and sheepishly beeps an ans for Threepio to translate. Leia continues to repeat the  sentence fragment over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my  only hope. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi.  You're my only hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he says it's nothing, sir. Merely  a malfunction. Old data. Pay it no  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke becomes intrigued by the beautiful girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she? She's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she was a passenger on our  last voyage. A person of some  importance, sir -- I believe. Our  captain was attached to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there more to this recording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke reaches out for Artoo but he lets out several franti squeaks and a whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behave yourself, Artoo. You're going  to get us in trouble. It's all right,  you can trust him. He's our new  master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo whistles and beeps a long message to Threepio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's the property of Obi-Wan  Kenobi, a resident of these parts.  And it's a private message for him.  Quite frankly, sir I don't know what  he's talking about. Our last master  was Captain Antilles, but with what  we've been through, this little R2  unit has become a bit eccentric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obi-Wan Kenobi? I wonder if he means  old Ben Kenobi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon, sir, but do you  know what he's talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know anyone named Obi- Wan, but old Ben lives out beyond  the dune sea. He's kind of a strange  old hermit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's gazes at the beautiful young princess for a few  moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder who she is. It sounds like  she's in trouble. I'd better play  back the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps something to Threepio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says the restraining bolt has  short circuited his recording system.  He suggests that if you remove the  bolt, he might be able to play back  the entire recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks longingly at the lovely, little princess and h really heard what Threepio has been saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H'm? Oh, yeah, well, I guess you're  too small to run away on me if I  take this off! Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke takes a wedged bar and pops the restraining bolt off Artoo's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The princess immediately disappears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, wait a minute. Where'd she go?  Bring her back! Play back the entire  message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps an innocent reply as Threepio sits up in  embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What message? The one you're carrying  inside your rusty innards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A women's voice calls out from another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke? Luke! Come to dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands up and shakes his head at the malfunctioning  robot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll be right there, Aunt  Beru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, but he appears to  have picked up a slight flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke tosses Artoo's restraining bolt on the workbench and hurries out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see what you can do with him.  I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Artoo) Just you reconsider playing that  message for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think he likes you at  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't like you either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's Aunt Beru, a warm, motherly woman, fills a pitcher with blue fluid from a refrigerated container in the well used kitchen. She puts the pitcher on a tray with some bo of food and starts for the dining area. Luke sits with his Uncle Owen before a table covered with steaming bowls of food as Aunt Beru carries in a bowl of grain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think that R2 unit we  bought might have been stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I stumbled across a recording  while I was cleaning him. He says he  belongs to someone called Obi-Wan  Kenobi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen is greatly alarmed at the mention of his name, but  manages to control himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he might have meant old  Ben. Do you know what he's talking  about? Well, I wonder if he's related  to Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen breaks loose with a fit of uncontrolled anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That old man's just a crazy old  wizard. Tomorrow I want you to take  that R2 unit into Anchorhead and  have its memory flushed. That'll be  the end of it. It belongs to us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking  for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't, I don't think he exists  any more. He died about the same  time as your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to forget it. Your only  concern is to prepare the new droids  for tomorrow. In the morning I want  them on the south ridge working out  those condensers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I think those new droids  are going to work out fine. In fact,  I, uh, was also thinking about our  agreement about my staying on another  season. And if these new droids do  work out, I want to transmit my  application to the Academy this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen's face becomes a scowl, although he tries to suppres it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the next semester before  harvest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, there're more than enough  droids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvest is when I need you the most.  Only one more season. This year we'll  make enough on the harvest so I'll  be able to hire some more hands. And  then you can go to the Academy next  year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke continues to toy with his food, not looking at his u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must understand I need you here,  Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's a whole 'nother year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's only one more season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke pushes his half-eaten plate of food aside and stands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's what you said last year  when Biggs and Tank left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like I'm going nowhere. I  have to finish cleaning those droids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resigned to his fate, Luke paddles out of the room. Owen  mechanically finishes his dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen, he can't stay here forever.  Most of his friends have gone. It  means so much to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to him next year. I  promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's just not a farmer, Owen. He  has too much of his father in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant twin suns of Tatooine slowly disappear behind a distant dune range. Luke stands watching them for a few  moments, then reluctantly enters the doomed entrance to t homestead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke enters the garage to discover the robots nowhere in  sight. He takes a small control box from his utility belt similar to the one the Jawas were carrying. He activates box, which creates a low hum, and Threepio, letting out a short yell, pops up from behind the Skyhopper spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing hiding there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio stumbles forward, but Artoo is still nowhere in  sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my fault, sir. Please don't  deactivate me. I told him not to go,  but he's faulty, malfunctioning;  kept babbling on about his mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke races out of the garage followed by Threepio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke rushes out of the small doomed entry to the homestea and searches the darkening horizon for the small triped a robot. Threepio struggles out of the homestead and on the salt flat as Luke scans the landscape with his  electrobinoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That R2 unit has always been a  problem. These astro-droids are  getting quite out of hand. Even I  can't understand their logic at times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I be so stupid? He's nowhere  in sight. Blast it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, sir, but couldn't we go  after him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too dangerous with all the  Sandpeople around. We'll have to  wait until morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen yells up from the homestead plaza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, I'm shutting the power down  for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll be there in a few  minutes. Boy, am I gonna get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes one final look across the dim horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that little droid is going  to cause me a lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he excels at that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning slowly creeps into the sparse but sparkling oasis the open courtyard. The idyll is broken be the yelling of Uncle Owen, his voice echoing throughout the homestead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke? Luke? Luke? Where could he be  loafing now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the kitchen is a worm glow as Aunt Beru  prepares the morning breakfast. Owen enters in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Luke this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he had some things to do  before he started today, so he left  early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh? Did he take those two new droids  with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he'd better have those units  in the south range repaired be midday  or there'll be hell to pay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock and sand of the desert floor are a blur as Three pilots the sleek Landspeeder gracefully across the vast  wasteland.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Luke leans over the back of the speeder and adjusts somet in the motor compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) How's that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio signals that is fine and Luke turns back into th wind-whipped cockpit and pops the canopy shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Ben Kenobi lives out in this  direction somewhere, but I don't see  how that R2 unit could have come  this far. We must have missed him.  Uncle Owen isn't going to take this  very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, would it help if you told him  it was my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening) Sure. He needs you. He'd probably  only deactivate you for a day or  so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deactivate! Well, on the other hand  if you hadn't removed his restraining  bolt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, there's something dead ahead  on the scanner. It looks like our  droid... hit the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high on a rock mesa, the tiny Landspeeder can be see gliding across the desert floor. Suddenly in the foregrou two weather-beaten Sandpeople shrouded in their grimy des cloaks peer over the edge of the rock mesa. One of the  marginally human creatures raises a long ominous laser ri and points it at the speeder but the second creature grab the gun before it can be fired. The Sandpeople, or Tusken Raiders as they're sometimes ca speak in a coarse barbaric language as they get into an  animated argument. The second Tusken Raider seems to get the final word and the nomads scurry over the rocky terra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tusken Raider approaches two large Banthas standing t to a rock. The monstrous, bear-like creatures are as larg as elephants, with huge red eyes, tremendous looped horns and long, furry, dinosaur-like tails. The Tusken Raiders  mount saddles strapped to the huge creatures' shaggy back and ride off down the rugged bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeder is parked on the floor of a massive canyon. L with his long laser rifle slung over his shoulder, stands before little Artoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, whoa, just where do you think  you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little droid whistles a feeble reply, as Threepio pos menacingly behind the little runaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Luke here is your rightful  owner. We'll have no more of this  Obi-Wan Kenobi jibberish... and don't  talk to me about your mission, either.  You're fortunate he doesn't blast  you into a million pieces right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on. It's getting late. I  only hope we can get back before  Uncle Owen really blows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind my saying so, sir,  I think you should deactivate the  little fugitive until you've gotten  him back to your workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's not going to try anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the little robot jumps to life with a mass of fr whistles and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my... sir, he says there are  several creatures approaching from  the southeast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke swings his rifle into position and looks to the sout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandpeople! Or worst! Come on, let's  have a look. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke carefully makes his way to the top of a rock ridge a scans the canyon with his electrobinoculars. He spots the two riderless Banthas. Threepio struggles up behind the y adventurer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two Banthas down there but  I don't see any... wait a second,  they're Sandpeople all right. I can  see one of them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke watches the distant Tusken Raider through his  electrobinoculars. Suddenly something huge moves in front his field of view. Before Luke or Threepio can react, a l gruesome Tusken Raider looms over them. Threepio is start and backs away, right off the side if the cliff. He can b heard for several moments as he clangs, bangs and rattles down the side of the mountain. The towering creature brings down his curved, double-poin gaderffii -- the dreaded axe blade that has struck terror the heart of the local settlers. But Luke manages to bloc the blow with his laser rifle, which is smashed to pieces The terrified farm boy scrambles backward until he is for to the edge of a deep crevice. The sinister Raider stands over him with his weapon raised and lets out a horrible  shrieking laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo forces himself into the shadows of a small alcove i the rocks as the vicious Sandpeople walk past carrying th inert Luke Skywalker, who is dropped in a heap before the speeder.  The Sandpeople ransack the speeder, throwing pa and supplies in all directions. Suddenly they stop. Then  everything is quiet for a few moments. A great howling mo is heard echoing throughout the canyon which sends the  Sandpeople fleeing in terror. Artoo moves even tighter into the shadows as the slight  swishing sound that frightened off the Sandpeople grows e closer, until a shabby old desert-rat-of-a-man appears an leans over Luke. His ancient leathery face, cracked and  weathered by exotic climates is set off by dark, penetrat eyes and a scraggly white beard. Ben Kenobi squints his e as he scrutinizes the unconscious farm boy. Artoo makes a slight sound and Ben turns and looks right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there! Come here my little  friend. Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo waddles over to were Luke lies crumpled in a heap a begins to whistle and beep his concern. Ben puts his hand Luke's forehead and he begins to come around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest easy, son, you've had a busy  day. You're fortunate you're still  in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben? Ben Kenobi! Boy, am I glad to  see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jundland wastes are not to be  traveled lightly. Tell me young Luke,  what brings you out this far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this little droid! I think he's  searching for his former master...  I've never seen such devotion in a  droid before... there seems to be no  stopping him. He claims to be the  property of an Obi-Wan Kenobi. Is he  a relative of yours? Do you know who  he's talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben ponders this for a moment, scratching his scruffy bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obi-Wan Kenobi... Obi-Wan? Now thats  a name I haven't heard in a long  time... a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my uncle knew him. He said  he was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's not dead, not... not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well of course, of course I know  him. He's me! I haven't gone by the  name Obi-Wan since oh, before you  were born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the droid does belong to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't seem to remember ever owning a  droid. Very interesting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly looks up at the overhanging cliffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we better get indoors. The  Sandpeople are easily startled but  they will soon be back and in greater  numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke sits up and rubs his head. Artoo lets out a pathetic beep causing Luke to remember something. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Artoo stands at the edge of a large sand pit and b to chatter away in electronic whistles and beeps. Luke an Ben stand over a very dented and tangled Threepio lying h buried in the sand. One of his arms has broken off. Luke tries to revive the inert robot by shaking him and t flips a hidden switch on his back several times until fin the mechanical man's systems turn on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? I must have taken a bad  step...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stand? We've got to get out  of here before the Sandpeople return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I can make it. You go  on, Master Luke. There's no sense in  you risking yourself on my account.  I'm done for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo makes a beeping sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. What kind of talk is  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Ben help the battered robot to his feet. Little  Artoo watches from the top of the pit. Ben glances around suspiciously. Sensing something, he stands up and sniffs air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, son... they're on the move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small, spartan hovel is cluttered with desert junk bu still manages to radiate an air of time-worn comfort and  security. Luke is in one corner repairing Threepio's arm, old Ben sits thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my father didn't fight in the  wars. He was a navigator on a spice  freighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what your uncle told you. He  didn't hold with your father's ideals.  Thought he should have stayed here  and not gotten involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fought in the Clone Wars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the  same as your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I'd known him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the best star-pilot in the  galaxy, and a cunning warrior. I  understand you've become quite a  good pilot yourself. And he was a  good friend. Which reminds me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben gets up and goes to a chest where he rummages around. As Luke finishes repairing Threepio and starts to fit the restraining bolt back on, Threepio looks at him nervously Luke thinks about the bolt for a moment then puts it on t table. Ben shuffles up and presents Luke with a short han with several electronic gadgets attached to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something here for you. Your  father wanted you to have this when  you were old enough, but your uncle  wouldn't allow it. He feared you  might follow old Obi-Wan on some  damned-fool idealistic crusade like  your father did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, if you'll not be needing me,  I'll close down for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben hands Luke the saber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fathers lightsaber. This is the  weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy  or as random as a blaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke pushes a button on the handle. A long beam shoots ou about four feet and flickers there. The light plays acros the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elegant weapon for a more civilized  time. For over a thousand generations  the Jedi Knights were the guardians  of peace and justice in the Old  Republic. Before the dark times,  before the Empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke hasn't really been listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did my father die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who  was a pupil of mine until he turned  to evil, helped the Empire hunt down  and destroy the Jedi Knights. He  betrayed and murdered your father.  Now the Jedi are all but extinct.  Vader was seduced by the dark side  of the Force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Force?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi  his power. It's an energy field  created by all living things. It  surrounds us and penetrates us. It  binds the galaxy together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artoo makes beeping sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's see if we can't figure  out what you are, my little friend.  And where you come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw part of the message he was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is cut short as the recorded image of the beautiful  young Rebel princess is projected from Artoo's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seem to have found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stops his work as the lovely girl's image flickers b his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Kenobi, years ago you served  my father in the Clone Wars. Now he  begs you to help him in his struggle  against the Empire. I regret that I  am unable to present my father's  request to you in person, but my  ship has fallen under attack and I'm  afraid my mission to bring you to  Alderaan has failed. I have placed  information vital to the survival of  the Rebellion into the memory systems  of this R2 unit. My father will know  how to retrieve it. You must see  this droid safely delivered to him  on Alderaan. This is our most  desperate hour. Help me, Obi-Wan  Kenobi, you're my only hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a little static and the transmission is cut shor Old Ben leans back and scratches his head. He silently pu on a tarnished chrome water pipe. Luke has stars in his e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must learn the ways of the Force  if you're to come with me to Alderaan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Alderaan? I'm not going to Alderaan.  I've got to go home. It's late, I'm  in for it as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help, Luke. She needs  your help. I'm getting too old for  this sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get involved! I've got work  to do! It's not that I like the  Empire. I hate it! But there's nothing  I can do about it right now. It's  such a long way from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your uncle talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) Oh, God, my uncle. How am I ever  going to explain this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learn about the Force, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can take you as far as  Anchorhead. You can get a transport  there to Mos Eisley or wherever you're  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must do what you feel is right,  of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Imperial Stardestroyer heads toward the evil planet-li battle station: the Death Star!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight Imperial senators and generals sit around a black  conference table. Imperial stormtroopers stand guard arou the room. Commander Tagge, a young, slimy-looking general is speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until this battle station is fully  operational we are vulnerable. The  Rebel Alliance is too well equipped.  They're more dangerous than you  realize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bitter Admiral Motti twists nervously in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dangerous to your starfleet,  Commander, not to this battle station!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rebellion will continue to gain  a support in the Imperial Senate as  long as....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly all heads turn as Commander Tagge's speech is cu short and the Grand Moff Tarkin, governor of the Imperial outland regions, enters. He is followed by his powerful a The Sith Lord, Darth Vader. All of the generals stand and bow before the thin, evil-looking governor as he takes hi place at the head of the table. The Dark Lord stands behi him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Imperial Senate will no longer  be of any concern to us. I've just  received word that the Emperor has  dissolved the council permanently.  The last remnants of the Old Republic  have been swept away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible! How will the  Emperor maintain control without the  bureaucracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The regional governors now have direct  control over territories. Fear will  keep the local systems in line. Fear  of this battle station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what of the Rebellion? If the  Rebels have obtained a complete  technical readout of this station,  it is possible, however unlikely,  that they might find a weakness and  exploit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plans you refer to will soon be  back in our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any attack made by the Rebels against  this station would be a useless  gesture, no matter what technical  data they've obtained. This station  is now the ultimate power in the  universe. I suggest we use it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be too proud of this  technological terror you've  constructed. The ability to destroy  a planet is insignificant next to  the power of the Force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to frighten us with your  sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader. Your  sad devotion to that ancient religion  has not helped you conjure up the  stolen data tapes, or given you  clairvoyance enough to find the  Rebel's hidden fort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Motti chokes and starts to turn blue under Vader spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find your lack of faith disturbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this! Vader, release him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bickering is pointless. Lord  Vader will provide us with the  location of the Rebel fortress by  the time this station is operational.  We will then crush the Rebellion  with one swift stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeder stops before what remains of the huge Jawas  Sandcrawler. Luke and Ben walk among the smoldering rubbl and scattered bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like Sandpeople did this,  all right. Look, here are Gaffi  sticks, Bantha tracks. It's just...  I never heard of them hitting anything  this big before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is crouching in the sand studying the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't. But we are meant to  think they did. These tracks are  side by side. Sandpeople always ride  single file to hide there numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the same Jawas that sold  us Artoo and Threepio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these blast points, too accurate  for Sandpeople. Only Imperial  stormtroopers are so precise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would Imperial troops want to  slaughter Jawas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks back at the speeder where Artoo and Threepio a inspecting the dead Jawas, and put two and two together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they traced the robots here, they  may have learned who they sold them  to. And that would lead them home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke reaches a sudden horrible realization, then races fo the speeder and jumps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Luke! It's too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke races off leaving Ben and the two robots alone with burning Sandcrawler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke races across the wasteland in his battered Landspeed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeder roars up to the burning homestead. Luke jumps out and runs to the smoking holes that were once his home Debris is scattered everywhere and it looks as if a great battle has taken place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Owen! Aunt Beru! Uncle Owen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stumbles around in a daze looking for his aunt and u Suddenly he comes upon their smoldering remains. He is  stunned, and cannot speak. Hate replaces fear and a new  resolve comes over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imperial TIE fighter races toward the Death Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two stormtroopers open an electronic cell door and allow  several Imperial guards to enter. Princess Leia's face is filled with defiance, which slowly gives way to fear as a giant black torture robot enters, followed by Darth Vader

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, now Your Highness, we will  discuss the location of your hidden  Rebel base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torture robot gives off a steady beeping sound as it  approaches Princess Leia and extends one of its mechanica arms bearing a large hypodermic needle. The door slides s and the long cell block hallway appears peaceful. The muf screams of the Rebel princess are barely heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a large bonfire of Jawa bodies blazing in front the Sandcrawler as Ben and the robots finish burning the  dead.  Luke drives up in the speeder and Ben walks over t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing you could have done,  Luke, had you been there. You'd have  been killed, too, and the droids  would be in the hands of the Empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to come with you to Alderaan.  There's nothing here for me now. I  want to learn the ways of the Force  and become a Jedi like my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Landspeeder with Luke, Artoo, Threepio, and Ben in it zooms across the desert. The speeder stops on a bluff  overlooking the spaceport at Mos Eisley. It is a haphazar array of low, grey, concrete structures and semi-domes. A harsh gale blows across the stark canyon floor. Luke adju his goggles and walks to the edge of the craggy bluff whe Ben is standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mos Eisley Spaceport. You will never  find a more wretched hive of scum  and villainy. We must be cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks over at Luke, who gives the old Jedi a determin smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeder is stopped on a crowded street by several com hardend stormtroopers who look over the two robots. A Tro questions Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you had these droids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About three or four seasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're for sale if you want them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see your identification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke becomes very nervous as he fumbles to find his ID wh Ben speaks to the Trooper in a very controlled voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to see his  identification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need to see his  identification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are not the droids your looking  for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are not the droids we're looking  for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can go about his business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go about your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Luke) Move along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move along. Move along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeder pulls up in front of a rundown blockhouse can on the outskirts of the spaceport. Various strange forms transport, including several unusual beasts of burden, ar parked outside the bar. A Jawa runs up and begins to fond the speeder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't abide these Jawas. Disgusting  creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Luke gets out of the speeder he tries to shoo the Jawa away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, go on. I can't understand how  we got by those troopers. I thought  we were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Force can have a strong influence  on the weak-minded. You will find it  a powerful ally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think we're going to  find a pilot here that'll take us to  Alderaan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, most of the best freighter  pilots can be found here. Only watch  your step. This place can be a little  rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come along, Artoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young adventurer and his two mechanical servants foll Ben Kenobi into the smoke-filled cantina. The murky, mold den is filled with a startling array of weird and exotic  alien creatures and monsters at the long metallic bar. At first the sight is horrifying. One-eyed, thousand-eyed, s furry, scaly, tentacled, and clawed creatures huddle over drinks. Ben moves to an empty spot at the bar near a grou of repulsive but human scum. A huge, rough-looking Barten stops Luke and the robots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't serve their kind here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke still recovering from the shock of seeing so many  outlandish creatures, doesn't quite catch the bartender's drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your droids. They'll have to wait  outside. We don't want them here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks at old Ben, who is busy talking to one of the  Galactic pirates. He notices several of the gruesome crea along the bar are giving him a very unfriendly glare. Luke pats Threepio on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, why don't you wait out by  the speeder. We don't want any  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heartily agree with you sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threepio and his stubby partner go outside and most of th creatures at the bar go back to their drinks. Ben is standing next to Chewbacca, an eight-foot-tall sav looking creature resembling a huge grey bushbaby monkey w fierce baboon-like fangs. His large blue eyes dominate a covered face and soften his otherwise awesome appearance. Over his matted, furry body he wears two chrome bandolier and little else. He is a two-hundred-year-old Wookiee and sight to behold. Ben speaks to the Wookiee, pointing to Luke several times during his conversation and the huge creature suddenly le out a horrifying laugh. Luke is more than a little bit  disconcerted and pretends not to hear the conversation be Ben and the giant Wookiee. Luke is terrified but tries not to show it. He quietly si his drink, looking over the crowd for a more sympathetic or whatever. A large, multiple-eyed Creature gives Luke a rough shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negola dewaghi wooldugger?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hideous freak is obviously drunk. Luke tries to ignor the creature and turns back on his drink. A short, grubby Human and an even smaller rodent-like beast join the  belligerent monstrosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like you either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
